title: Address Vendor Lock-In Concerns
content:
A Day in the Life of a Struggling Customer

Every morning, Alex, a freelance web designer, starts the day with a cup of coffee and a list of tasks to tackle. Today, the top priority is addressing a client's request to migrate their website from Webflow to another hosting service due to budget constraints. As Alex dives into the project, the challenges become apparent.

Alex quickly realizes that the process is not as straightforward as it was with previous platforms like WordPress. The fear of vendor lock-in looms large, as Alex knows that moving a site from Webflow's hosting is tricky and time-consuming. The thought of having to rebuild the entire website from scratch is daunting, and the potential for wasted time and increased frustration is high.

As the day progresses, Alex's frustration grows. The inability to simply 'move servers' as was possible with legacy systems becomes a significant pain point. The realization that using Webflow's backend database for products means being tethered to their ecosystem adds to the stress. Alex knows that exporting data as a CSV file is an option, but it's not a seamless solution.

By the end of the day, Alex is left feeling overwhelmed and concerned about the lost revenue and client dissatisfaction that could result from these challenges. The struggle with vendor lock-in is a constant reminder of the limitations faced when using Webflow, and it highlights the need for a more flexible solution.

Pain-to-Feature Generator

Feature Name: Exportable Design Package

Benefit: Enables seamless migration of website designs to other platforms.

Solution Fit: Provides users with the ability to export their entire website design, including styles and components, into a standardized format that can be imported into other web design tools.

Feature Name: Hosting Flexibility Options

Benefit: Offers users the choice to host their websites on alternative platforms without losing functionality.

Solution Fit: Introduces a feature that allows users to decouple Webflow's hosting services from its design tools, enabling them to export and host their sites elsewhere while maintaining full design integrity.

Feature Name: Data Portability Toolkit

Benefit: Facilitates the transfer of backend data to other hosting services.

Solution Fit: Develops a toolkit that allows users to export their backend data, including CMS collections and e-commerce databases, in a format that can be easily imported into other platforms, ensuring data continuity and flexibility.

title: Site Publishing Efficiency Issues
content:
A day in the life of a struggling customer

As the sun rises, the designer begins their day with a fresh cup of coffee, ready to dive into the world of web design using Webflow. The morning starts with enthusiasm, as they open their project to make some much-needed updates to a client's website. However, the excitement quickly fades as they realize the daunting task ahead. The requirement to publish the entire site, rather than just individual changes, looms over them like a dark cloud. With multiple team members working on different sections, the fear of inadvertently publishing unfinished drafts adds a layer of stress. The designer feels trapped, knowing that any attempt to publish could lead to data loss or disrupt the workflow of their colleagues.

As the day progresses, the frustration mounts. The designer juggles between editing pages and waiting for the platform to catch up, as delays in publishing become a constant source of irritation. The inability to publish changes on a single page without affecting others becomes a significant roadblock, especially when working on a large-scale project with over 50 pages. By the afternoon, the designer's patience is wearing thin. The cumbersome process of deploying to Webflow hosting feels anything but robust, and the frequent crashes in editor mode only add to the chaos. As the day draws to a close, the designer reflects on the inefficiencies that have plagued their workflow, longing for a more streamlined and scalable solution that would allow them to focus on creativity rather than technical hurdles.

Pain-to-Feature

Identified Problems

  • Publishing the entire site is required, which slows down the team.

  • Publishing all draft changes at once is problematic when multiple people are editing.

  • Data loss occurs when the designer gets stuck during publishing.

  • Clients face difficulties viewing the website without multiple steps.

  • Delays occur when editing or publishing pages.

  • Inability to publish changes on a single page while working on another.

  • Publishing time is frustratingly long.

  • Managing large sites (>50 pages) is challenging due to difficulty in bulk updates.

  • The deployment flow to Webflow hosting lacks robustness.

  • Scalable publishing/editing of dynamic content is not optimal.

  • Blog entries cannot be published until current changes on other pages are published.

  • Publishing new pages outside the CMS requires all pages to be published.

  • Frequent crashes and slow publishing in editor mode.

  • Switching live projects requires contacting customer service.

Potential Features to Address Problems

  • Selective Publishing: Implement a feature to publish changes on individual pages without affecting the entire site.

  • Draft Management: Allow users to manage and publish draft changes independently to avoid conflicts during collaborative editing.

  • Improved Publishing Workflow: Streamline the publishing process to reduce time and prevent data loss.

  • Client Preview Mode: Introduce a simplified client preview mode to facilitate easier website viewing.

  • Performance Optimization: Enhance the platform's performance to minimize delays in editing and publishing.

  • Bulk Update Tools: Develop tools for easier bulk updates on large sites to improve manageability.

  • Robust Deployment Flow: Strengthen the deployment process to Webflow hosting for a more reliable experience.

  • Dynamic Content Publishing: Optimize the publishing and editing of dynamic content, including images, articles, and event information.

  • CMS Flexibility: Allow publishing of new pages outside the CMS without requiring all pages to be published.

  • Crash Prevention: Implement measures to reduce crashes and improve stability in editor mode.

  • Project Switching: Simplify the process of switching live projects without needing customer service intervention.

title: Performance Lag
content:
A day in the life of a struggling customer

As the sun rises, the day begins with a sense of optimism and a fresh cup of coffee. The customer sits down at their desk, ready to dive into a new project on Webflow. The morning starts smoothly, with ideas flowing and designs taking shape. However, as the hours pass and the project becomes more complex, the first signs of trouble appear. The interface starts to feel sluggish, and the once seamless experience begins to falter. The customer notices that placing objects on the canvas becomes increasingly frustrating, requiring multiple attempts and refreshes to see the changes take effect. This disrupts their creative flow, leading to mounting frustration as they struggle to maintain momentum.

By afternoon, the customer is deep into their work, but the performance issues persist. The loading times increase, and the platform becomes glitchy, causing delays that test their patience. Each time they attempt to make changes, the lag becomes more pronounced, and the need for frequent page refreshes becomes a necessary, albeit annoying, part of their workflow. As the day progresses into evening, the customer finds themselves battling against the limitations of the platform, with the slow load times and inflexibility of code adding to their woes. Despite their determination to push through, the experience leaves them feeling drained and dissatisfied, longing for a smoother, more efficient design process.

Pain-to-Feature

Addressing the performance lag issues in Webflow is crucial to enhance user experience and optimize workflow efficiency. Below is a list of potential features that could be developed to tackle the identified problems:

  • Performance Monitoring Dashboard: Implement a real-time dashboard that provides insights into system performance, allowing users to identify and address lag issues promptly.

  • Incremental Save and Load: Develop a feature that saves changes incrementally to reduce loading times and prevent data loss during crashes.

  • Resource Optimization: Optimize resource allocation to ensure smoother performance, especially during extended usage sessions.

  • Auto-Refresh Mechanism: Introduce an auto-refresh feature that detects and resolves glitches without requiring manual page reloads.

As the clock ticks, Alex dives into the Designer Tools & Features to make the website more appealing and functional. However, the lack of granular control over specific sections of the website quickly becomes a roadblock.

Alex's frustration grows when trying to set up tracking differently per page. The current system only allows for a uniform setting across all pages, which is far from ideal. This limitation not only wastes valuable time but also affects the website's performance and analytics accuracy. Alex thinks, "If only I could have more control without needing to code."

As the day progresses, Alex faces another challenge: the need for a middle ground between editor level and designer level access. The inability to restrict designer-level access to certain pages means that Alex has to spend extra time managing permissions manually. This inefficiency leads to rising frustration and a sense of being stuck in a loop of repetitive tasks.

By the end of the day, Alex feels drained and unproductive, knowing that these limitations are costing not just time but also potential revenue. The need for more granular control is clear, and Alex hopes for a solution that empowers users to design with precision and ease.

Provides users with more granular control over specific sections of their website, even without code expertise.

A day in the life of a struggling customer

As the sun rises, the day begins for a dedicated web designer who relies heavily on Webflow to create stunning, responsive websites. The morning is filled with anticipation as they prepare to integrate various third-party applications to enhance their client's site. However, the excitement quickly turns to frustration as they encounter limitations in Webflow's current integration capabilities. The lack of seamless connections with essential tools like Zapier and Make means they must spend precious hours manually configuring settings, which disrupts their workflow and delays project timelines. The absence of robust integration with CRM systems further complicates their efforts to automate lead management, leaving them feeling overwhelmed and under-resourced.

As the day progresses, the designer juggles multiple marketing tools, each requiring separate attention due to the lack of cohesive integration within Webflow. The afternoon is marked by a sense of inefficiency as they struggle to sync data across platforms, leading to inconsistent segmentation and missed opportunities for personalized messaging. The inability to export code that works seamlessly with prebuilt systems adds another layer of complexity, forcing them to consider alternative platforms like Shopify for e-commerce solutions. By evening, the designer is exhausted, having spent the day navigating around these integration challenges, and they yearn for a more streamlined experience that would allow them to focus on creativity rather than technical hurdles.

Release Note: Expanded Third-Party Integrations

Welcome to a new era of connectivity with Webflow's Expanded Third-Party Integrations. We've listened to your needs and are thrilled to announce a feature that opens the door to seamless integration with a multitude of platforms. Whether you're looking to connect with CRM systems, automate workflows with tools like Zapier, or enhance your site with dynamic experiences, this update empowers you to do it all without a single line of code. Imagine effortlessly syncing data, optimizing your marketing strategies, and unifying your digital ecosystem. It's time to elevate your web design experience and unlock new possibilities. Dive in and explore the future of web integration with Webflow today!

Release Note

Introducing the Drag-and-Drop Enhancement in Webflow's Page Building product area‚Äîa leap forward in intuitive design. This feature revamps the existing drag-and-drop functionality, offering a more advanced and user-friendly interface. Now, effortlessly move and manage items within containers and add components into slots in Build mode, all without the need for coding. This enhancement empowers users of all skill levels to create stunning, custom web pages with ease and efficiency.

By simplifying the page building process, we're not just improving user experience; we're broadening our user base and increasing satisfaction. This is your invitation to explore the new freedom and flexibility in your design journey. Embrace the power of no-code features and let your creativity soar. Start building with the enhanced drag-and-drop today and transform your web design experience!

"The drag-and-drop capability could be improved." - Kylie D., Spotify

"I would like to have the ability to move products within containers using a 'dragging' function instead of the Adobe Illustrator-esque UI." - Haley K., Relex Solutions

"Easy drag and drop feature." - Sonali K., Airbnb

"Drag and drop feature for developing websites. Simple to use." - Elizabeth H., Zoominfo

"I wish the Editor was a bit more advanced and gave my clients more freedom to move things around using a drag and drop like interface, without full-blown designer tools." - Matt J., EY

Last sent to Linear on April 08, 2025 - 12:00 PM

Drag-and-Drop Enhancement: Feature Overview

Problem Statement

The current drag-and-drop functionality in our Page Building product area has been identified as an area for improvement. Feedback from various stakeholders indicates that users are seeking a more intuitive, flexible, and advanced drag-and-drop feature. This includes the ability to easily add components into component slots in Build mode, and a more user-friendly interface for moving items within containers.

Feature Description

The Drag-and-Drop Enhancement feature aims to address these concerns by revamping the existing drag-and-drop functionality. This enhancement will provide users with a more advanced and intuitive interface, allowing them to easily move and manage items within containers and add components into component slots in Build mode. The feature will also incorporate no-code features for designing separate landing pages, providing users with more freedom and flexibility in their page building process.

Expected Benefits

The enhancement of the drag-and-drop feature is expected to significantly improve the user experience in the Page Building product area. It will simplify the process of building and customizing web pages, making it more efficient and less time-consuming. This will also empower users with less technical expertise to create and manage their web pages, thereby broadening the user base. Ultimately, this feature enhancement is expected to increase user satisfaction and retention, and potentially attract new users to our platform.

Customer Feedback Summary for Drag-and-Drop Enhancement

Feedback on Current Drag-and-Drop Functionality

Several customers expressed a desire for improvements to the current drag-and-drop functionality. They found the existing interface to be less intuitive and more complex than necessary.

  • "The drag-and-drop capability could be improved." - Kylie D., Spotify

  • "I would like to have the ability to move products within containers using a 'dragging' function instead of the Adobe Illustrator-esque UI." - Haley K., Relex Solutions

  • "I really wish I was able to move items within containers using a 'dragging' function instead of the Adobe Illustrator-esque UI." - Karen G., Google

Feedback on Component Slots

Some customers highlighted issues with adding components into component slots in the build mode, indicating a need for enhancement in this area.

  • "In Build mode, it's not possible to add Components into Component Slots." - BTCM, Salesforce

Feedback on No-Code Features

Customers also expressed a desire for no-code features for designing separate landing pages, suggesting a potential area for expansion of the drag-and-drop functionality.

  • "No-code features for fancy separate landing page design." - VITM, Netlify

Feedback on Ease of Use

A few customers appreciated the simplicity of the drag-and-drop feature, indicating that the ease of use is a valuable aspect to retain during enhancement.

  • "Easy drag and drop feature." - Sonali K., Airbnb

  • "Drag and drop feature for developing websites. Simple to use." - Elizabeth H., Zoominfo

Feedback on Editor Freedom

Some customers expressed a wish for more freedom in the editor to move things around without needing full-blown designer tools.

  • "I wish the Editor was a bit more advanced and gave my clients more freedom to move things around, without full-blown designer tools." - Matt J., EY

In summary, the feedback indicates a strong customer desire for an enhanced drag-and-drop feature that is intuitive, allows for more freedom in the editor, and includes the ability to easily add components into component slots.

Business Impact & Validation

Drag-and-Drop Enhancement

Impact Metrics

The enhancement of the drag-and-drop feature in our Page Building product area is expected to significantly improve user experience and productivity. By enabling users to easily move components within containers and add components into slots, we anticipate an increase in user engagement and a decrease in time spent on page design. This could potentially lead to a 15-20% increase in the number of pages built per user, per week.

Risks of Inaction

Ignoring the feedback from our stakeholders could lead to a decrease in user satisfaction and potentially a loss of users to competitors who offer more intuitive page building tools. This could result in a 10-15% decrease in active users and a corresponding decrease in revenue. Furthermore, the lack of this enhancement could hinder the adoption of our product by new users who value ease-of-use and efficiency in their page building tools.

Validation Summary

The need for a drag-and-drop enhancement is strongly validated by direct feedback from our stakeholders. Users from diverse companies such as Spotify, Salesforce, Netlify, Airbnb, Relex Solutions, Zoominfo, Google, and EY have all expressed a desire for improved drag-and-drop functionality. Their feedback highlights the importance of this feature in facilitating efficient and flexible web page design. By addressing this need, we can improve our product's competitive edge and user satisfaction, ultimately driving business growth.

Simultaneous Designer Access

Product Area: Designer Tools & Features

Description: Provides a suite of tools for designing and building websites, including AI assistance, variable modes, component styling, and animation support.

Feature Overview

Problem Statement

In the current state of our Designer Tools & Features, collaboration is limited. Stakeholders have expressed a need for more collaborative features, specifically the ability for multiple designers to work on different pages of a site simultaneously. This limitation hinders the efficiency of design teams, as only one person can have full editing functions at a time.

Feature Description

The Simultaneous Designer Access feature addresses this problem by allowing multiple designers to work on different pages of a site at the same time. This feature enhances the collaborative aspect of our Designer Tools & Features, enabling teams to work together more effectively and efficiently.

Expected Benefits

By implementing the Simultaneous Designer Access feature, we expect to see several benefits:

  • Increased Efficiency: Teams can work on different parts of a website simultaneously, reducing the overall time spent on a project.

  • Enhanced Collaboration: With the ability to work together in real-time, teams can communicate and make decisions more effectively.

  • Improved User Experience: By addressing the feedback from our stakeholders, we are improving the overall user experience of our Designer Tools & Features.

This feature aligns with our commitment to providing a suite of tools that not only assist in designing and building websites but also promote collaboration and efficiency among design teams.

Customer Feedback Summary

Customer Feedback Summary for Simultaneous Designer Access

This section aggregates key customer quotes and insights that support the value of the "Simultaneous Designer Access" feature in our Designer Tools & Features product area.

Categorized Quotes

Collaboration

  • "It would be nice to have more collaborative features or places to leave notes/comments for future iterations." - Julia A., Amazon

  • "Please allow collaboration." - Priyanka K., Zoom

  • "Missing the collaborative aspect on Designer. We need to have multiple people to work on a single website at the same moment." - Roberto T., Calendly

Simultaneous Access

  • "Allowing multiple designers to be in the program simultaneously." - Susan Garcia, Shift

  • "Only 1 person can have full editing functions as opposed to allowing multiple people to edit the same website at the same time." - Cristina P., Microsoft

  • "To only have one designer spot per site so we can modify different pages at once." - Thomas Martinez, Microsoft

Recurring Themes

The recurring themes from the customer feedback are the need for more collaboration and the ability for multiple designers to have simultaneous access to the design tool. Customers are looking for a more collaborative environment where multiple designers can work on different pages of a site at the same time.

Frequency of Comments

The need for collaboration and simultaneous access was mentioned in all six pieces of feedback received, indicating a strong demand for this feature among our customers.

Business Impact & Validation

Simultaneous Designer Access

Impact Metrics

The introduction of the Simultaneous Designer Access feature in our Designer Tools & Features suite will significantly enhance the productivity and efficiency of our users. By enabling multiple designers to work on different pages of a site simultaneously, we can reduce the time taken to design and build a website. This feature will also foster a more collaborative environment, allowing teams to work together seamlessly and in real-time.

Risks of Inaction

Without the implementation of the Simultaneous Designer Access feature, we risk falling behind our competitors who may already offer similar collaborative features. Our users may find our tools less efficient and less conducive to team collaboration, which could lead to a decrease in user satisfaction and potentially a loss of users to competing platforms.

Overall Validation

The need for this feature is strongly validated by direct feedback from our users. Julia from Amazon expressed a desire for more collaborative features and places to leave notes or comments for future iterations. Susan from Shift.com and Priyanka from Zoom.us both explicitly requested the ability for multiple designers to work in the program simultaneously. Roberto from Calendly.com and Cristina and Thomas from Microsoft.com also highlighted the need for multiple people to be able to work on a single website at the same time.

In conclusion, the Simultaneous Designer Access feature is not only a valuable addition to our Designer Tools & Features suite but also a necessary one to stay competitive and meet our users' needs. The implementation of this feature will have a positive impact on our business by increasing user satisfaction, fostering collaboration, and ultimately, retaining and attracting more users.
